model

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoPlayer, HumanPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class allow the game engine to instanciate from 2 to 4 players. This class is abstract and implement the common functions a Player must have to play the game. Each object is linked to a batch of cards that represent the player's cards.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Titouan LE BERRE
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String name,
              int id,
              Game game)
        The class' constructor, that create a player with a name, an id, and a default amount of coins and actions.
        Parameters:
        name - The player's name
        id - The player's id, that need to be between 0 and 4 (excluded)
        game - The game where the object player is playing

        public void setCoins(int coins)

        coins - The new amount of coins.

        Returns:

        This method is a setter that set the value of the player's remaining actions. This method is useful to update the actions attribute after an action has been done.
        Parameters:
        actions - The new amount of actions.

        public void setVPoints(int points)

        points - The new amount of actions bought.

        public boolean buyAction()
        This method allows a Player object to purchase a new action in exchange of some of his coins.
        Returns:
        true if the action has been correctly done, false otherwise.

      • recruit

        public boolean recruit(Ouvrier ouvr)
        This method allows a Player object to recruit a new worker displayed on the board.
        Parameters:
        ouvr - The Ouvrier object to add to the ArrayList of owned Ouvrier
        Returns:
        true if the action has been correctly done, false otherwise.

      • openBuild

        public boolean openBuild(Card bat)
        This method allows a Player object to open a new construction among the Batiment/Machine displayed on the board.
        Parameters:
        bat - The building to put under construction.
        Returns:
        true if the action has been correctly done, false otherwise.

      • sendToWork

        public boolean sendToWork(Card ouvr,
                          Card bat)
        This method allows a Player object to send to work a worker. It will link an Ouvrier Card to a Batiment/Machine card.
        Parameters:
        ouvr - The Ouvrier object to link.
        bat - The building on which the Ouvrier object will work.
        Returns:
        true if the action has been correctly done, false otherwise.

      • takeCoin

        public boolean takeCoin(int nbActions)
        This method allows a Player object to exchange some of his actions for coins.
        Parameters:
        nbActions - The number of actions to exchange, that must be between 1 & 3.
        Returns:
        True if everything went well, false otherwise.

        This method allow the player to make a move.
